author: mysticryuujin
content: Has it been determined if cross client validator to beacon node communication will be a supported (or required) scenario? E.G. Lighthouse Validator <-> Prysm Beacon Node?

author: djrtwo
content: there is a common API being worked on that many clients plan to adopt. This would generally enable this feature

author: djrtwo
content: it is a nice to have but not a requirement. The API first and foremost is to allow for val keys to be in a small, well-audited, and isolated piece of software

author: djrtwo
content: and secondly to allow for innovation in this layer (e.g. trustless staking pools, etc)

author: djrtwo
content: and could allow for laod balancing a single val against multiple node implementations and things like that

author: mysticryuujin
content: Right...I'm just thinking of a scenario where a bad beacon-node implementation or bug takes down one of the clients...the validators go down too without the ability to talk to another beacon-node client. Of course you can go through re-importing signing keys but that seems like a lot to ask end users.

author: djrtwo
content:
yeah, that's a nice to have too

<@!545555441518772225> has a lodestar val talking to a lighthouse BN so it's def possible and might become more so soon
